triples.name: Constraint programming
triples.relevance: SCIP is a constraint integer programming solver based on the constraint programming paradigm.

triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: The paper discusses enhancements to solving integer programming problems, a core focus of SCIP.

triples.name: Linear programming
triples.relevance: SCIP uses linear programming relaxations within its branch-and-bound framework.

triples.name: Branch and bound
triples.relevance: The branch-and-bound algorithm is the fundamental technique at the core of SCIP.

triples.name: Cutting-plane method
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 includes new cut generators and cut selection schemes based on cutting-plane methods.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper mentions improvements and additions to primal heuristics for finding good solutions.

triples.name: Symmetry-breaking constraints
triples.relevance: SCIP 9.0 includes improved symmetry handling, a key optimization technique.
